body: The most consecutive tandem push-ups (male) is 43 and was achieved by George Kotsimpos and Apostolos Dervas (both Greece), in Heraklion, Crete, Greece, on 21 December 2022.
The pair beat the previous holders by 4 push-ups.
The fastest half marathon (female) - CIH is 1 hr 47 min 55.46 sec, and was achieved by Emily Fairbanks (USA), in Payson, Utah, USA, on 27 August 2022.

Emily decided to attempt this Guinness World Records title to inspire those who are specifically afflicted with cerebral palsy, those with any form of disability, and those who are able-bodied to start being active or continue to be active even when it can get hard.

She started running at age 38 and still can't believe that at age 46 she has been able to run this fast and achieve this record. Emily says that It felt so good to finish strong and say to her daughter as she finished the last stretch that she had crushed this race.

A 3,106-carat gem-quality rough diamond was found on 26 January 1905 at the Premier Diamond Mine, near Pretoria, South Africa, and presented to the reigning British monarch, Edward VII. Named The Cullinan, it was cut into 106 polished diamonds.

It produced the largest cut fine-quality colourless diamond, Star of Africa which weighs 530.2carats and tops the Royal Sceptre, and the Cullinan II which resides in the Imperial State crown that Queen Elizabeth II dons for the State Opening of Parliament. The Queen is said to call the smaller diamonds "Granny's rocks".
The most piercings in the tongue is 20 and was achieved by Francesco Vacca (USA) at Invisibleself in Lyndhurst, New Jersey, USA, on 5 January 2017.
Frank previously held the record with 16 piercings. He then got two more piercings (totalling 18) and finally decided to get two more, bringing the total to 20.

titlesInfo.Who: Maha Hair & Beauty Institutions, Da Extensionzz, Vels University

body: The longest hair extension (team) is 484.5 m (1589.56 ft), and was achieved by Maha Hair & Beauty Institutions, Da Extensionzz, and Vels University (all India) in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, India, on 6 March 2019.
The extension was made with all pink hair in honour of breast cancer awareness.

The longest mountain coaster (or alpine coaster) ride is Tobotronc, which has operated at the Naturlandia resort near Sant Julià de Lòria, Andorra, since 2007. The track's total length is 5,300 m (17,400 ft), with a fast-descent stage that is 3,600 m long (11,811 ft) and drops 400 m (1,312 ft) over its length.

A mountain coaster (also known as an alpine coaster) is a type of roller coaster that runs on a track that mostly follows the terrain of a hill or mountain. Typically these roller coasters use one- or two-person toboggan-like sleds, which allow the user some control over their speed, rather than the multi-person trains of a conventional roller coaster.
The most consecutive handstand push ups is 52, and was achieved by Viktor Nabok (Ukraine) in Kiev, Ukraine, on 16 September 2019.
By attempting this record Victor wanted to highlight that human abilities have no limits.
The most people performing pushups is 2,926, achieved by the US Air Force Academy (USA) in Colorado Springs, Colorado, USA, on 20 April 2023.
Cadets performed pushups on the USAFA's Terrazzo, a plaza in the middle of the campus.
The most push ups to planks in one minute is 66, and was achieved by Alex Goulding (UK), in London, UK, on 5 May 2023.
Alex is an advocate of mental health awareness and is a multiple record holder in the discipline of push ups.

titlesInfo.Who: El Sistema Nacional de Orquestas y Coros Juveniles e Infantiles de Venezuela

body: The largest orchestra consists of 8,573 musicians and was achieved by El Sistema Nacional de Orquestas y Coros Juveniles e Infantiles de Venezuela (Venezuela), in Caracas, Venezuela, on 13 November 2021.

El Sistema is a National Institution of Youth and Children's Orchestras and Choirs of Venezuela for the collective and individual practice and instruction of music through symphony orchestras and choirs.

The orchestra was composed by piccolos, flutes, oboes, clarinets, horns, cornets, trumpets, trombones, tubas, violins, among other instruments. The musicians aged between 12 and 77, playing a piece by Tchaikovsky: the Slavic March.

The most people performing synchronized backflips on pogo sticks is 15 and was achieved by Pogopalooza Pittsburgh Athletes (USA) at Pogopalooza Pittsburgh in Point State Park in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA, on 2 July 2014.
The longest marathon drumming by an individual is 134 hr 5 min, and was achieved by Steve Gaul (Canada) in Burlington, Ontario, Canada, from 14 to 19 August 2015.
Steve made his record attempt to raise funds for Cardiac Kids in support of SickKids Foundation of Toronto, Canada.

The largest firework display consists of 810,904 fireworks and was achieved by Iglesia Ni Cristo (Church of Christ) (Philippines), at the Countdown to 2016 New Year Celebrations, in the Philippine Arena, Ciudad de Victoria Bocaue Bulacan, Philippines, on 1 January 2016.
The display began at the stroke of midnight 2016 and lasted for 1 hour 1 minute 32.35 seconds, in the pouring rain.
The longest birthday is 48 hours, and was achieved by Paul Morgan (USA) in Lihue, Hawaii, USA on 3 February 2018.

Paul's record-breaking attempt took place in Apia, Samoa; Auckland, New Zealand; Los Angeles, California, USA and Lihue, Hawaii, USA. Paul made his record-breaking attempt to celebrate his 28th birthday.
The fastest completion of Teamwork Temple, Wii Party (Wii) is 57 seconds, achieved by Tristen Geren and Taylor Geren (both USA), in Fredericksburg, Texas, USA, on 16 February 2013.
The most chest to ground push up burpees in 24 hours (female) is 6,260 and was achieved by Tammy Kovaluk (Canada) in Bend, Oregon, USA, on 5-6 June 2021.
Tammy attempted this record to raise funds for Harmony Farm Sanctuary, an animal rescue for abused and abandoned farm animals, where she often volunteers.

She trained for 5 months in advance of the attempt. This included weight vest burpees, weight vest push ups, and plyometric push ups, and a mixture of large sets, medium, and smaller sets to work strength, speed, and endurance.
She achieved both this record, and most chest to ground push up burpees in 12 hours (female) during the event.
The most 180 push ups in one minute (male) is 23, and was achieved by Alex Goulding (UK), in London, UK, on 5 May 2023.
Alex is an advocate for mental health awareness and a multiple record holder in the discipline of push ups.
The longest tongue (female) measures 9.75 cm (3.8 in) from the tip to the middle of lip and was achieved by Chanel Tapper (USA), California, USA on 29 September 2010.
The most tattooed woman ever is Charlotte Guttenberg (USA), who has 98.75% of her body tattooed, as verified in Melbourne, Florida, USA, on 7 November 2017.
At the time of approval, Charlotte also holds the records for the most tattooed female senior citizen and the most feathers tattooed on the body.
The fastest marathon wearing a wetsuit is 3 hr 14 min 16 sec and was achieved by Alistair Kealty (Australia) at the Antwerp Marathon, Belgium, on 28 April 2019.
Alistair is a keen record breaker.
The highest jump into the water with a bicycle is 17 meters (56 ft) and was achieved by Vittorio Brumotti (Italy) in Sardinia, Italy, on 12 May 2009. Story to be added
The highest upward basketball shot is 15.26 m (50 ft 1 in), and was achieved by Corey "Thunder" Law of the Harlem Globetrotters in Salt Lake City, Utah, USA, on 5 November 2017.
This attempt was done in celebration of Guinness World Records Day 2017.

It is possible to credit the earliest cinematic superhero if the term “superhero” is narrowly defined. Not until Adventures of Captain Marvel (USA) in March 1941 had moviegoers seen a comic-book adaptation in which an ordinary man, transformed into a costumed hero with superhuman powers.

Contrary to popular belief, Superman was not the first comic book superhero. That honour falls instead to The Phantom, created in 1936 by the American cartoonist Lee Falk, two years before Superman. The Phantom newspaper strip featured the adventures of Kit Walker, who sported a mask and a figure-hugging purple outfit as “the ghost who walks”.
The first superhero MMORPG was City of Heroes, which was first released in April 2004 by NCSOFT. The game ran until 30 November 2012.
n/a
The fastest Wales N-S crossing by Standard Bicycle (WUCA) (Male) (Solo) is 8 hr 35 min and was achieved by Maxwell Randles-Hall (United Kingdom) on 4 September 2022.

Maxwell Randles-Hall rode from the Entrance to Talacre Beach Car Park to Barry Idsland Car Park covering 174.8 Miles (281.3 Km) in 8 hours and 35 minutes for an average speed of 20.37 mph (32.77 kph). WUCA
The most consecutive backflips on a pogo stick is 21, and was achieved by Henry Cabelus (USA) in New Hope, Pennsylvania, USA, on 5 May 2022.
Henry broke his own record of 20, set in 2017.

The longest single fingernail ever belonged to Shridhar Chillal (India), who stopped trimming the nails of his left hand in 1952. His coiled thumbnail measured 197.8 cm (6 ft 6 in) on 17 November 2014.
In 2018, Chillal lost his record for longest nails on one hand; after 66 years of growth, he had his 909.6-cm (29-ft 10-in) nails cut with a Dremel rotary saw.

The longest fingernails on a single hand - ever measure an aggregate length of 909.6 cm (358.1 in) and were achieved by Shridhar Chillal (India) on his left hand as measured in Pune city, Maharashtra, India, on 17 November 2014.
The nails are on Shridhar Chillal's left hand and have individual measurements of:
